snippet: The administration of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg championed the open evaluation of teachers, but it has refused to release a draft report on the 911 system, after denying it existed.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on the double standards of the Bloomberg administration regarding the public's right to know; notes that city officials are fully supporting campaign to make public the evaluations of about 18,000 teachers, even with flaws, but are refusing to disclose recent evaluation of city's troublesome 911 system.
lead_paragraph: The administration of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg championed the open evaluation of teachers, but it has refused to release a draft report on the 911 system, after denying it existed.

headline.main: For City Hall, 2 Standards on the Public’s Right to Know
